body.p: The liver is covered with a visceral peritoneum. These ligaments are useful anatomic positions but serve little physiological purpose aside from attaching the liver to the body wall and other structures. The ligamentum teres (round ligament) runs along the inferior border of the falciform ligament. Tapered extensions of the parietal peritoneum, called the right and left coronary ligaments, hang the liver from the diaphragm.
